result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn M. Hartline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment of Costs + service fees + DV surcharge + DNA surcharge = $615.00 due at the rate of $100/month commencing 10-1-2022 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections
Huber release if in compliance with jail rules and regulations.

records.addlTxt:
3:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Mitchell John Philbin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dawn M. Hartline in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Dawn M. Hartline. 
Atty Spansail - plea today, provides form, confirms JT would be removed.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Spansail agrees.
ADA reads charge in Count 1.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters n/c plea.
Non-citizen advisory.
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Atty Spansail - satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty.
ADA heard on sentencing.
Atty Spansail heard on sentencing.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes: 10 days jail w/Huber release if in compliance with jails rules and regulations to report by 8-23-22 by 7:00 pm.
Payment of costs + service fees + DV surcharge + DNA surcharge = $615 due at a rate of $100 per mth comm 10-1-22 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
DNA sample due 8-23-22.
Appeal rights.
Court cancels JT.
4:04 pm

11:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Robert James Mraz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dawn M. Hartline in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Dawn M. Hartline. 
Court calls case. 
Atty requests to set for trial. 
Parties agree to a 1 day trial.
All motions, verdicts, and proposed jury instruction to be filed no later than close of business on August 1, 2022.
Court schedules with parties.
11:34 AM
Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

08:34 AM Defendant Dawn M. Hartline in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case. 
Atty is being heard- has reviewed complaint with Deft. 
Enters NG plea and requests stc.
Court schedules with parties. 
8:36 AM  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.

08:43 AM Defendant Dawn M. Hartline in court.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case.
Deft spks- has not received a copy of complaint.
DA provides copy to Deft. 
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties. 
Deft spks- has been in contact with public defenders office but has not been appointed counsel. 
DA is being heard on signature bond. 
Deft is being heard and reports that she has had continued contact with P.H.
Deft provides updated address. 
Court imposes $500 signature bond, sign waiver of extradition and no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx. 
Allows deft to continue to have contact with P.H. 
Court schedules with parties. 
08:48 AM
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
